title: Christmas needs a rebrand, blah blah blah
author: Si_Daniels

comments.content: You didn't post this on the Font ID Board, but Beirut used [Bryant 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20121102080538/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html) for the rebrand.

He's right it's

“nice and bulbous and round-y, kind of snowball-like,”

Sweet!

If anything, the idea that x.mas sounds remotely cool or new shows how old and out of touch some people at Pentagram really are. Either that or it's just a brilliant touch of sarcasm to go along with the idea that Christmas needs re-branding. Either way, I hope that they sell copies of the prospectus; [from what I've seen online](http://web.archive.org/web/20121102080538/http:/www.studio360.org/episodes/2006/12/22) it looks great.

The irony of graphic designers trying to 'fix' the 'overcommercialization' of xmas is just too much.

And .mas? Trite even by non xmas/non designer standards.

Unless, as jpad speculates, they're being sarcastic with the x.mas. If so, perhaps they're being a tad too subtle.

I am quite sure it is all tongue quite firmly in cheek.  
I got a good laugh out of it but I may be old and out of touch too:-)

ChrisL

<cite>If so, perhaps they’re being a tad too subtle.</cite>

That's the problem with Pentagram; sometimes it's to to figure out when the work is amazing and when they need to get out of the office more often.
